A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is engulfed in flames and also burns for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.
If damage from this effect kills a target, the target is turned to ash.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The satyr's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The satyr can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Faun Resilience
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The satyr makes two attacks: one with his ram and one with his greatclub.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Dark Urges
entries: The satyr touches a creature and magically knows the creature's current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 13 Charisma saving throw, the satyr also knows the creature's alignment, and its flaw. On a failed save, the creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a failure, the satyr magically influences the creature to indulge in its flaw, with no regard for consequences. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect. The target pursues the course of action suggested to the best of its ability for 1 day. If the satyr or its allies damage the target, the effect ends. If the target successfully saves against the effect, the target is immune to this satyr's Dark Urges for the next 24 hours.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Heart Sight
entries: As a bonus action, the leanan can choose one creature she can see within 60 feet of her and magically knows the creature's alignment, current emotional state and ideal, as long as the creature isn't hidden from divination magic by a spell or other magical effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The leanan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leanan can use her Exhilarating Gaze. She then makes three attacks: one with her ram and two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Exhilarating Gaze
entries: The leanan's eyes sparkle with enchanting light as she targets one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the leanan, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} until the end of the leanan's next turn. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, it is {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Kiss of the Wild
entries: The leanan kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by her or a willing creature. The target makes a DC 14 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is transformed (as the polymorph spell) into the type of beast with a challenge rating of 1 or less that it identifies most with (creature's choice). In this form, the creature retains its mental ability scores and ability to speak. Whenever the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. After three failed saving throws, the transformation can be undone only by a remove curse spell or similar magic. If the target successfully saves against the effect, the target is immune to this leanan's Kiss of the Wild for the next 24 hours.

variant.name: Menad
entries: Menads are trusted leanans that serve as advisors, judges, or emissaries of powerful archfey of the Seelie Court. A menad has a challenge rating of 6 (2,300 XP) and the following additional trait:
Spellcasting. The satyr is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 14). The satyr has the following bard spells prepared:

items: At will: {@spell friends}, {@spell message}
1st level (4 slots): {@spell charm person}, {@spell heroism}
2nd level (3 slots): {@spell calm emotions}, {@spell zone of truth}
3rd level (3 slots): {@spell sending}, {@spell tongues}
4th level (3 slots): {@spell compulsion}, {@spell polymorph}
5th level (2 slots): {@spell animate objects}, {@spell geas}

trait.name: Clumsy Moves
entries: While the siren is neither flying nor swimming, attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The siren can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The siren makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the siren can grapple the target (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the siren can't use its tail against another target.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The siren covers itself with a magical illusion that makes it look like a beautiful man or woman of it general size and shape. The effect ends if the siren takes a bonus action to end it or if it dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the siren could appear to have no claws, but someone touching its hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the siren is disguised.

trait.name: Clumsy Moves
entries: While the ekhidna is neither flying nor swimming, attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The ekhidna has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The ekhidna can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ekhidna makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail constrict.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the ekhidna can't constrict another target.

action.name: Shriek
entries: Each creature within 20 feet of the ekhidna that can hear its shriek and that isn't a siren must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the ekhidna's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the ekhidna's shriek for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Clumsy Moves
entries: While the melusina is neither flying nor swimming, attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Kraken's Blessing
entries: The AC of the melusina includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The melusina can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The melusina makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail constrict.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the melusina can't constrict another target.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The melusina covers itself with a magical illusion that makes it look like a beautiful man or woman of it general size and shape. The effect ends if the siren takes a bonus action to end it or if it dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the melusina could appear to have no claws, but someone touching its hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the siren is disguised.

legendary.name: Retreat
entries: The melusina moves up to half its flying or swimming speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: The melusina makes one attack with its claws.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The melusina cast a spell from its list of Innate Spellcasting or Spellcasting feature, using a daily use or a spell slot as normal.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The melusina's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The melusina can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell control weather} (at sea or coastal region only)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The melusina is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14). It has the following cleric spells prepared:
footerEntries: 2nd Level (3 slots): hold person, mirror image
4th Level (3 slots): guardian of faith, polymorph

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph into a Medium female humanoid or back into its true form. While in humanoid form, its statistics, are the same. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Elusive
entries: Attack rolls made against the vampire have disadvantage unless the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. No attack roll has advantage against the vampire while it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

{@i Blood Addiction.} If the temptation for blood is strong (an open wound, the smell of blood), the vampire has disadvantage on blood frenzy saving throws. In the presence of the blood of a virgin the vampire fails automatically.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 14).

action.name: Bite (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The alp's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The alp can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

variant.name: Deathwail Alp
entries: A deathwail alp has a challenge rating of 8 (3,900 XP) and the following additional action options:

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The alp can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The alp regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

entries.name: Hide
entries: The vampire makes a Dexterity (Stealth) check.

entries.name: Rush
entries: The vampire may move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes a claws attack.

entries.name: Deathwail (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire screams in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn .

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph in to a Medium female humanoid or back into its true form. While in humanoid form, its statistics, are the same. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Blood Addiction} In the presence of the blood of a fey creature the vampire fails automatically blood frenzy saving throws.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity} While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire uses its Otherworldly Gaze and makes two melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 15).

action.name: Bite (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Otherworldly Gaze
entries: The vampire targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition blinded} until the end of the bruxa's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration.

action.name: Eerie Scream (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vampire releases a eerie scream, provided that it isn't in sunlight. This scream has no effect on construct and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of it must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, taking 45({@dice 10d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, its also {@condition frightened} until the end of the bruxa's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bruxa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18). The bruxa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

variant.name: Kiss of Darkness
entries: Some of the most talented bruxae learn the ability to enthrall a person with a kiss, much in the same way other vampires use their gaze to do so. A bruxa with the kiss of darkness option has a challenge rating of 10 (5,900 XP). When a humanoid or an undead kisses a bruxa, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the vampire until the vampire dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the vampire's control and can't take reactions, and the vampire and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the vampire.

variant.name: Night Mother
entries: Night mothers grow in power and occult knowledge over the centuries. A bruxa night mother has a challenge rating of 12 (8,400 XP) and the following additional traits and action options:
Spellcasting. The bruxa is a 10th-level spellcaster. her spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The bruxa has the following spells prepared:

items: Cantrips (at will): {@spell mage hand}, {@spell ray of frost}, {@spell thaumaturgy}
1st level (4 slots): {@spell inflict wounds}, {@spell shield}
2nd level (3 slots): {@spell hold person}, {@spell mirror image}
3rd level (3 slots): {@spell counterspell}, {@spell lightning bolt}, {@spell slow}
4th level (3 slots): {@spell charm monster}, {@spell shadow of Moil}
5th level (3 slots): {@spell cone of cold}, {@spell wall of force}

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The bruxa can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The bruxa regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

entries.name: Otherworldly Gaze
entries: The bruxa uses its Otherworldly Gaze.

entries.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bruxa makes one bite attack.

entries.name: The bruxa makes one bite attack.
entries: The bruxa cast a spell from her list of Innate Spellcasting or Spellcasting feature, using a daily use or a spell slot as normal.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The vampire can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. During daylight hours the regeneration of the vampire is reduced to 10 hit points.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack, or it makes two melee attack and turn {@condition invisible} before or after the attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or lose 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to internal injuries. Each time the vampire hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 7 ({@dice 2d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 16).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The vampire magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the vampire wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

variant.name: Ekimmara Scourge
entries: Some very old and powerful ekimmaras reach extraordinary level of cunning and cruelty, they are nicknamed scourge. An ekimmara scourge has a challenge rating of 12 (8,400 XP) and the following additional action options:

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The ekimmara can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ekimmara regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

entries.name: Escape
entries: The vampire use Invisibility and may move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Claws (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one attack with its claws.

entries.name: Cruel Slaughter (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes an attack with its claws against one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or die. If the target dies, each creature of the vampire's choice that is within 60 feet of it and able to see it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the vampire for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish; the GM controls the creature's movement, which is erratic. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vampire's Cruel Slaughter for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The vampire can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Fear of Sunlight
entries: While in sunlight, the vampire is {@condition frightened} and has disadvantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Leap Attack
entries: If the vampire jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement next to a creature, then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 14).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Agony Aura
entries: Any creature that doesn't have all its hit points that starts its turn within 10 feet of the vampire must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The vampire can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Fear of Sunlight
entries: While in sunlight, the vampire is {@condition frightened} and has disadvantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Leap Attack
entries: If the vampire jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement next to a creature, then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 16).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Foul Presence
entries: Any non-undead creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the vampire must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is failed by 5 or more, it's also {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the vampire's Foul Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stain
entries: If a humanoid is wounded by the vampire, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or contract a supernatural disease. The diseased target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the disease reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. The disease lasts until removed by a lesser restoration spell or other magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 15).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster.name: Alpha Garkain
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Grievous Presence
entries: Any non-undead creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the garkain must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws and vulnerability to all damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the vampire's Grievous Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stain
entries: If a humanoid is wounded by the vampire, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or contract a supernatural disease. The diseased target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the disease reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. The disease lasts until removed by a lesser restoration spell or other magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire can use its Stun Blast. It then makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 17).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Stun Blast (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vampire releases psychic energies in a 60-foot cone, provided that it isn't in sunlight. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: As a bonus action, the vampire can polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form. While in mist form, the vampire can't speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 60 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage.

trait.name: Enigmatic Nature
entries: The vampire is immune to effects that turn undead, as well as any divination spell that it refuses.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The vampire's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Monstrous Form (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight and if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining, the vampire immediately polymorph into a Large monstrous form for 10 minutes. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies. While in monstrous form, the vampire has the following traits:
The vampire cannot use its shapechanger feature and has disadvantage on blood frenzy saving throws.
The vampire gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only) or Dash action.
The vampire gains a flying speed of 150 feet.
The vampire has resistance to all damage except radiant damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 30 hit points at the start of its turn. If a magical piercing weapon made of silver is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated}, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn. The vampire dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the vampire is killed, it regains all its hit points at the next sunset unless its body was destroyed, in which case it will take {@dice 1d10} year to rejuvenate at the location of its death. If another higher vampire reduces its Constitution to 0 with its bite attack or it is killed during a total solar eclipse, the vampire is destroyed for good.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Absent Reflection} The vampire does not appear in mirrors or reflective surfaces.
{@i Blood Addiction} If the vampire used successfully its bite or blood drain attack on a creature in the past 24 hours, the vampire has disadvantage on blood frenzy saving throws.

{@i Dalvenite Allergy} The vampires is allergic to dalvenite, a costly alloy composed of meteoric steel and silver. If the vampire starts its turn within 5 feet of dalvenite it cannot use its Shapechanger and Monstrous Form feature until the end of its turn. The vampire automatically fails Strength ability checks to break dalvenite.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire and Monstrous Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 21).

action.name: Bite (Vampire and Monstrous Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage and the target's Constitution score is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Blood Drain (Mist Form Only)
entries: One creature in the vampire's space must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw (undead and constructs automatically succeed). On a failed save, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) necrotic damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest. It dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: The vampire makes one attack with its claws.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

entries.name: Blood Sense
entries: The vampire can sense living creatures that have blood or similar vital fluids in a radius of 240 feet.

entries.name: Blood Cauldron (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vampire targets a living creature that have blood or similar vital fluids that it can see within 30 feet of it, making its blood boil. The target must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage plus 27 ({@damage 5d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 50 necrotic damage plus 50 fire damage.

entries.name: Blood Call (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire targets up to two living creature that have blood or similar vital fluids that it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. A target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. A target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Weave the Mortal Coil
entries: The vampire can cast {@spell raise dead} and {@spell create undead} at will, requiring no components and at any higher level it wishes to. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma.

entries.name: Wind of Death (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vampire summons a gust of deathly wind in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 67 ({@damage 15d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the wind reduces it to 0 hit points. A humanoid slain by the wind rises 1 minute later as a zombie under the vampire's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed.

entries.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the vampire's gaze for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Alpha Vampire
entries: The vampire can cast {@spell antipathy/sympathy} at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma (spell save DC 21). This use of the spell can only affect lesser vampires.

entries.name: Feral Swarm (Recharge 5-6)
entries: A giant swarm of bats gather around the higher vampire and descend upon a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 32 ({@damage 7d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 32 ({@damage 7d8}) piercing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Ancient Might (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one attack with its claws. If it hits, the attack is a critical hit. A creature taking damage from the attack suffers from a Lingering Injury (See p. 272 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

entries.name: Night Blood
entries: When it is an area of dim light or darkness the vampire is {@condition invisible}.

entries.name: Feed the Darkness (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vampire targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or be magically {@condition restrained} by tendrils of solid shadow. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and is transported to a random location on the Shadowfell. A creature so transported must find its own way back to its plane of existence.

entries.name: Shadow Mirror (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. Alternatively, it can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is unwilling, it must make on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, both creatures teleport, swapping places.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph in to a Medium humanoid or back into its true form. While in humanoid form, its statistics, are the same. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Blood Scent
entries: The vampire can automatically smell blood within the range of its blindsight. The vampire can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened} and unable to smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. During daylight hours the regeneration of the vampire is reduced to 10 hit points.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Blood Addiction} In the presence of the blood of its favorite type of prey the vampire has disadvantage on blood frenzy saving throws.

{@i Garlic Aversion} The vampire has a strong aversion to the smell of garlic, it cannot use its blindsight when garlic is present within its blindsight range and if the vampire comes within 5 feet of a clove of garlic it is {@condition poisoned} until it leaves the area.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity} While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack or it makes two melee attack and turn {@condition invisible} before or after the attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d12 + 8}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or lose 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to internal injuries. Each time the vampire hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 7 ({@dice 2d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 18 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 18).

action.name: Bite (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Greater Invisibility
entries: The vampire magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the vampire wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

legendary.name: Ethereal Stride
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. The vampire can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its move inside an object.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Darkness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire casts darkness, no concentration requiered.

legendary.name: Fear the Night (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, when the creature is in dim light or darkness, it is {@condition frightened} and can't regain hit points. The curse lasts until it is removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes a claws attack against each creature within 10 feet of him.

variant.name: Nekurat
entries: Nekurats are a rare breed of katakan living in the Shadowfell. They are rarely seen outside of places influenced by this plane. A nekurat has a challenge rating of 17 (18,000 XP) and the following additional traits and action options:
Spellcasting. The nekurat is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The nekurat has the following wizard spells prepared:

items: Cantrips (at will): {@spell chill touch}, {@spell minor illusion}
1st level (4 slots): {@spell detect magic}, {@spell fog cloud}
2nd level (3 slots): {@spell detect thoughts}, {@spell gust of wind}
3rd level (3 slots): {@spell animate dead}, {@spell bestow curse}
4th level (3 slots): {@spell blight}, {@spell locate creature}
5th level (2 slots): {@spell cloudkill}, {@spell legend lore}
6th level (1 slots): {@spell circle of death}, {@spell create undead}
7th level (1 slots): {@spell plane shift} (Shadowfell only), {@spell symbol}

entries.name: Nether Bite
entries: The bite of a nekurat is especially dangerous. When a creature suffers from a nekurat's bite attack it must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. At the end of its turn the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a non-evil humanoid dies from the necrotic damage, a {@creature shadow} rises from the corpse in the next round.

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The nekurat can use the additional legendary actions.

entries.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire cast a spell from its list of Spellcasting feature, using a spell slot as normal.

entries.name: Suffocating Darkness (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire surrounds itself with magical darkness for 1 minute. The effect is identical to the darkness spell. The darkness emanates from the nekurat and moves with him. Any creature in the darkness suffocates, as if they are running out of breath (see p.183 of the Player's Handbook).

monster.name: Mula
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: As a bonus action, if the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form. While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 60 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the vampire used successfully its bite attack on a creature on the previous turn it regains 30 hit points instead. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn. The vampire dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the vampire is killed, it regains all its hit points at the next sunset unless its body was destroyed, in which case it will take {@dice 1d10} year to rejuvenate in a nearby grave. If its body is burned and the ashes are dispersed in at least two separate bodies of running water (stream, river, ocean...), the vampire is destroyed for good.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Blood Addiction} In the presence of the blood of an evil alignment creature the vampire fails automatically blood frenzy saving throws.
{@i Fear of the Sacred} If the vampire takes radiant damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
{@i Hallowed Ground} The vampire cannot step into a temple or a place of worship. Such places are considered under the influence of a hallow spell for the vampire.

trait.name: Voracious Rage
entries: As a bonus action, if the vampire used successfully its bite attack on a creature on the previous turn, the vampire can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts until the end of the vampire's next turn or until the vampire is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the vampire gains the following benefits:
The vampire has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
The vampire is immune against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and against features that turn undead.
The vampire has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire uses its Manifest Fear and makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 18).

action.name: Bite (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Manifest Fear (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it, wracking it with terrible pain and psychic terror. The target must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition frightened}.

monster.name: Vargheist
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The vampire has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the vampire is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vampire doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach .

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 16).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn .

entries.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the vampire's choice that is within 120 feet of the vampire and aware of it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the ancient vargheist's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The varghulf can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Monstrous Leap
entries: The varghulf's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 25 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The varghulf regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the varghulf takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The varghulf takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The varghulf makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} + {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 4d12 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the varghulf can't bite another target.

legendary.name: Hunger's Call
entries: the varghulf moves up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Red Thirst
entries: One creature that the varghulf is grappling with its bite takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the varghulf regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. If the varghulf kills a creature with its Red Thirst, it gains an additional action on its next turn.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The varghulf makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Warp Spawn
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Otherworldly Presence
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the spawn and can see it, the spawn can force the creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw if the spawn isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature acquires a short-term madness randomly determined which lasts for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the madness on a success. A creature which already has a short-term madness, is immune to psychic damage, or which has succeeded on a saving throw to this spawn's Otherworldly Presence in the last 24 hours is immune.

trait.name: Warp Form
entries: The warp spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Whenever the spawn starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spawn is {@condition incapacitated} for one round as its thrashes between nightmarish forms.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The warp spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warp spawn uses its Mutated Beyond Reason and makes three melee attacks; one with its bite, one with its claws and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or
smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 15).

action.name: Mutated Beyond Reason
entries: The warp spawn mutates and selects one of the options below.
1. Deadly Mutation. The spawn moves from its speed and makes a tentacle attack.

2. Eldritch Burst. Great bolts of eldritch energy are arcing out of the warp spawn. A line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from it in a direction it chooses. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
3. Regeneration. The warp spawn regains 10 hit points.

reaction.name: Mask of Insanity
entries: When a creature the spawn can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the aberration, the spawn can wrap its mind in psychic terror. If the creature can see the spawn, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its turn.

monster.name: Balewing
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Otherworldly Presence
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the balewing and can see it, the balewing can force the creature to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw if the balewing isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature acquires a short-term madness randomly determined which lasts for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the madness on a success. A creature which already has a short-term madness, is immune to psychic damage, or which has succeeded on a saving throw to this balewing's Otherworldly Presence in the last 24 hours is immune.

trait.name: Magic Attack
entries: The balewing's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balewing has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The balewing makes four melee attacks; one with its bite and three with its tendrils. It can use Hurl Balefire in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hurl Balefire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15ft., one target. Hit 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

action.name: Eldritch Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The balewing exhales arcs of energy in an 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 5d10}) lightning damage and 28 ({@damage 5d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated, as per the disintegrate spell.

monster.name: Dluur
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dluur can breathe air and water.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dluur remains motionless in water under the surface, it is indistinguishable from a normal patch of lure weed.

trait.name: Lure
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the dluur and can see the dluur's illicium, the dluur can force the creature to make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw if the dluur isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition charmed}, the creature must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as close as its speed allows toward the dluur. The effect ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dluur makes two claws attacks. It can use Acid Spit in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

reaction.name: Psychic Assault
entries: When a creature the dluur can see starts its turn {@condition charmed} within 60 feet of the aberration, the dluur can attack its mind with psychic powers. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its turn.

monster.name: Dolgotha
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Acid Blood
entries: When the dolgotha takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the dolgotha takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Acid Fog
entries: A 20-foot-radius sphere of acid fog surrounds the dolgotha. The fog spreads around corners. Its area is heavily obscured. When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 23 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Strong wind disperses the fog for {@dice 1d4} turns before it returns.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dolgotha can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Fog Crawler
entries: While in the fog, The dolgotha can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns and has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dolgotha makes three melee attacks; one with its beak and two with its chelipeds.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. Hit 27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Chelipeds
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the dolgotha jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a DC 19 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target' s choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage , isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the dolgotha's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the dolgotha's space.

action.name: Corrosive Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The dolgotha exhales acid in 60-foot cone. Each creature in that cone must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) acid damage on a failed save, and 23 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

variant.name: Pale One
entries: Some legendary albino dolgothas, known as pale ones, have a strong connection to the Far Realm. A pale one with an Intelligence of 14 (+2) and a telepathy of 120 ft. has a challenge rating of 16 (15,000 XP) and the following additional action option:

reaction.name: Psychic Backslash
entries: Immediately after a creature casts an illusion or enchantment spell that targets the dolgotha or includes it in its area of effect, the dolgotha can use its reaction to absorb the magic of the spell, cancelling its effect. Additionally, the creature that casted the spell must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 1d8} psychic damage per level of the spell slot absorbed.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The uhogguath can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the uhogguath can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The uhogguath can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Ethereal Web
entries: The ground in a 30-foot radius around the uhogguath is covered in semi-solid ethereal webs, making the area difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the ethereal web until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uhogguath makes two melee attacks; one with its bite and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 14) and must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Drain Intellect (Recharge 4-6)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the uhogguath. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and the target must make a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them. At the end of a long rest, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this effect, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration spell cast on the target also ends the effect.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered.

trait.name: Fury
entries: While it has 100 hit points or lower, or the full moon is up in the sky, the werewolf has advantage on attack rolls. Additionally, the werewolf's melee attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The ulfhedinn has advantage on
Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the werewolf fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The werewolf's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the werewolf moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the werewolf can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ulfhedinn uses its Frightful Presence, and makes two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5ft.,one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the werewolf's choice that is within 120 feet of the werewolf and aware of it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving
throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a
creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the werewolf's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The werewolf moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: The Beast Within (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ulfheddin targets one creature cursed with lycanthropy that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On failure, the creature instantly polymorph into its hybrid form, cannot shapeshift back to other forms, and is {@condition charmed} by the ulfhedinn. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Eye of Winter (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ulfheddin targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw, it is also {@condition petrified}, encaised in ice until the end of the werewolf's next turn.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The voref regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the werewolf takes damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the werewolf's next turn .

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the werewolf is killed, it regains all its hit points in 24 hours, unless wolfsbane is placed on its body, in which case it will take {@dice 1d10} days to rejuvenate. If silver pierces the heart of the werewolf during the full
moon, the werewolf is truly dead.

trait.name: Voref Weaknesses
entries: The voref has the following flaws:

{@i Call of the Moon.} During the night of the full moon the true nature of the voref is revealed. The creature automatically polymorph into its hybrid form and acts according to its alignment. The werewolf is also free to ignore its master's order during these nights.
{@i Voice of the Master.} The voref is completely under the thrall of the person that cursed it. It is considered under the permanent effects of the dominate monster spell from its master.

{@i Wolsbane Allergy.} If the werewolf comes within 20 feet of aconitum flowers it is {@condition poisoned} until it leaves the area. Weapons coated with aconitum oil ignore the damage invulnerabilities of the werewolf.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The voref can use its Howl at the Moon. It then makes three melee attacks: one with its cursed bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Claws (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the werewolf has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Cursed Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft.,one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the werewolf has more than half of its total hit points remaining. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target can't regain hit points and has vulnerability to all damage. Greater restoration, remove curse, or similar magic ends the curse on the target.

action.name: Howl at the Moon (Hybrid Form Only; Recharge 5-6)
entries: The werewolf howls with an insane look in its eyes. All creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be under the effects of a confusion spell for one minute. At the end of each of its turn a creature can reattempt the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The naglfar is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the naglfar must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The naglfar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Soul Choir
entries: Any creature within 30 feet of the naglfar that isn't immune to be {@condition frightened} hears in its mind the screams of the hundreds of souls trapped in the ship. As a bonus action, the naglfar can force all affected creatures to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature falls {@condition unconscious}. The effect ends on the creature if it is waked up by the lesser restoration spells or similar magic. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the Soul Choir for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 5d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Trap Soul
entries: The naglfar targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the naglfar regains 22 ({@dice 5d8}) hit points. A creature killed by this attack cannot be brought back to life until the naglfar is destroyed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The naglfar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The naglfar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Force Disruption
entries: Whenever the spectral hunt takes force damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Herald of the Void
entries: At the start of each of the spectral hunt's turns, each creature within its space must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Void Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points.

action.name: White Frost's Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) cold damage. If the target is killed by this damage, it becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

trait.name: Force Disruption
entries: Whenever the spectral hunt takes force damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Herald of the Void
entries: At the start of each of the spectral hunt's turns, each creature within its space must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spectral hunt makes two melee attacks. When its Soul Tear is available, it can use it in place of one attack.

action.name: Void Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points.

action.name: White Frost's Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) cold damage. If the target is killed by this damage, it becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

action.name: Soul Tear (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The spectral hunt targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it.The target must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw, taking 61 ({@damage 7d8 + 30}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the creature is cursed with Soul Torment (see Appendix).

legendary.name: Boreal Winds
entries: The spectral hunt erupts into an icy whirlwind. Each creature within its space must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The spectral hunt may then move up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The spectral hunt makes one melee attack.

legendary.name: Flash Freeze (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The area within the hunt's space freezes instantly. Nonmagical fires in the area are extinguished, water in the area freezes, and the ground becomes difficult terrain. Spells that protect against cold damage are dispelled.

legendary.name: Glacial Vortex (Costs 3 Actions)
