entries: The spectral hunt chooses a point that it can see within 90 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage and be {@condition petrified}, encased in ice, until the end of the spectral hunt's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't {@condition petrified}.

trait.name: Force Disruption
entries: Whenever the spectral king takes force damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spectral king can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the spectral king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spectral king makes three melee attacks. When its Soul Tear is available, it can use it in place of one attack.

action.name: Spectral Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) psychic damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Soul Tear (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The spectral king targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it.The target must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw, taking 61 ({@damage 7d8 + 30}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the creature is cursed with Soul Torment (see Appendix).

legendary.name: Rend Mind
entries: The spectral king targets one creature afflict ed by soul torment and that it can see with in 60 feet of the king. The creature must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature fall {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. The effect on the creature ends if it takes damage or if the creature is no longer afflicted by Soul Torment.

legendary.name: Phantasmal Killer (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The spectral king casts phantasmal killer (spell save DC 21), no concentration required.

legendary.name: Soul Bound
entries: (Costs 2 Actions). The spectral king targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. A crackling cord of negative energy tethers the spectral king to the target. Whenever the spectral king takes damage, the target must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spectral king takes half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage. This tether last until the end of the spectral king's next turn.

legendary.name: Doomsayer (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The spectral king targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered damage immunities cold

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The huntsman's weapon attacks are magical. When the huntsman hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Relentless Pursuer
entries: If the huntsman has even a tiny piece of a creature or an object in its possession, such as a lock of hair or a splinter of wood, it knows the distance to and the most direct route to that creature or object, even if the creature or object and the huntsman are on different planes of existence. A creature or an item that is hidden from divination magic is immune.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The huntsman makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Eldritch Shot (Recharge 5-6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) force damage plus 18 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Summon Hounds (1/Day)
entries: The huntsman attempts to magically summon {@dice 1d4 + 1} hound of the wild hunt with a 50 percent chance of success. If the attempt fails, the huntsman takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned hounds appear in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of its summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The huntsman's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The huntsman can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Bringer of Death
entries: Any creature hostile to the king that starts its turn within 20 feet of the king must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw, unless the king is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature has disadvantage on all saving throws. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the king's Bringer of Death for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: White Frost Weapons
entries: The king's weapon attacks are magical. When the king hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage and {@dice 4d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king can use its Proclaim Edict. It then makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Proclaim Edict
entries: The king targets up to three creatures that it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. In case of failure the target is under one of the following effects, chosen by the king:

1. Edict of Death. The next time the target is taking damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an equal amount and the Edict ends for it. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

2. Edict of Despair. Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw, the target must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw and the Edict ends for it.
3. Edict of Obedience. If the target makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage and the Edict ends for it.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The king magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Command the Hunt (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Up to three friendly creature within 120 feet of the king that can hear it can use their reactions to move up to their speed and each make one weapon attack.

legendary.name: Screaming Vortex (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The king targets a space that it can see within 60 feet of it. A vertical column of White Frost energies erupts from a dimensional rift at the location. Each creature in a 10-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point must succeed on a DC 21 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target' s choice) or be trapped by the vortex. While trapped, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it dies and no mortal magic can return that creature to life. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The target remains there until the effect ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. If the effect ends for a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or acquires a long-term madness randomly determined.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The king's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23). The king can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

variant.name: Spectral King
entries: With this option, the king has a challenge rating of 25 (75,000 XP) and the following trait:

entries.name: Spectral King (1/Day)
entries: As an action, the king psionically transform into the spectral king (see spectral hunt section), and can remain in this form for up to 12 hours. The king can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The king can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn. The king assumes the hit points of its new form, and when it reverts to its normal form, the king returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the king's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked {@condition unconscious}. While in this new form, the king retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Constitution and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, reactions and legendary actions that the new form has but that it lacks.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The navigator has 20 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When it casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, the navigator can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When it casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the navigator can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The navigator's weapon attacks are magical. When the navigator hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 5d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The navigator makes two quarterstaff attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) cold damage or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) cold damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Ice Orb
entries: The navigator hurls an ice orb at a point it can see within 150 feet of it. Each creature in a 15-footradius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Summon Elemental (3/Day)
entries: The navigator magically summons {@dice 1d4 + 1} hound of the wild hunt or {@dice 1d2} white frost elemental. The summoned creatures appear in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of their summoner and act as an ally of their summoner. They remain for 10 minutes, until they or their summoner dies, or until their summoner dismisses them as an action.

legendary.name: Permafrost Mantle
entries: The navigator creates an icy mantle of protection on itself. The next time that it takes bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, that damage is reduced to 0, and the mantle is destroyed.

legendary.name: Absorb Essence (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One elemental within 20 feet of the navigator takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage, and the navigator regains 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) sorcery points, up to its maximum of 20.

legendary.name: Ice Orb (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The navigator hurls an ice orb.

legendary.name: Mass Phase (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Up to three friendly fey creatures within 30 feet of the navigator can use their reactions to teleport, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied spaces they can see.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The navigator's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19). The navigator can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The rider's weapon attacks are magical. When the rider hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Unicorn Slayer
entries: When the rider hits a celestial with a weapon attack, the celestial takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage of the weapon's type.

trait.name: War Magic (Honor Guard Only)
entries: When a member of the honor guard uses its action to cast a cantrip, it can also take a bonus action to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rider makes two attacks.

action.name: Loa'then Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft ., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or it can't regain hit points until the curse is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic. If the spear is thrown, it immediately flies back in the rider's hands after the attack.

action.name: Summon Hounds (1/Day)
entries: The rider attempts to magically summon {@dice 1d4 + 1} hound of the wild hunt with a 50 percent chance of success. If the attempt fails, the rider takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned hounds appear in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of its summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

reaction.name: Frost Globe (2/Day)
entries: When the rider is hit by an attack, it becomes surrounded by a frost globe that has 50 hit points. Whenever the rider takes damage, the globe takes the damage instead. If a creature hits the globe with a melee attack, the creature takes 10 cold damage. If the globe is reduced to 0 hit points, the rider takes any remaining damage. While the globe remains, the rider is {@condition incapacitated} and regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rider's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The rider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting (Honor Guard Only)
headerEntries: While members of the honor guard are within 60 feet of a navigator, they can each cast the following spells but must share the daily uses among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, each member of the honor guard is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Charisma as its spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the member's Charisma modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the member's Charisma modifier.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Psychic Absorption
entries: Whenever the tormentor is subjected to psychic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt.

trait.name: Psychic Weapons
entries: The tormentor's weapon attacks are magical. When the tormentor hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tormentor makes two attacks, only one of which can be with its psychic whip.

action.name: Psyblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Psychic Whip
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) psychic damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 17) if it is a Large or smaller creature. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to 20 feet closer to the tormentor. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tormentor can't use its psychic whip on another target.

action.name: Soul Drain (Recharges 5-6)
entries: The tormentor targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that isn't an undead, elemental or construct. The target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 37 ({@damage 5d8 + 15}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the creature is cursed with Soul Torment (see Appendix).

legendary.name: Psychic Leech
entries: One creature that the tormentor is grappling with its psychic whip takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage and the tormentor regains hit points equal to that amount.

legendary.name: Torment (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tormentor targets one creature afflicted by soul torment and that it can see within 30 feet of the tormentor. The creature must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn and the tormentor immediately recharges Soul Drain. While {@condition frightened} in this way, whenever the tormentor takes damage, the target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the tormentor takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature takes the other half.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The tormentor's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The general's weapon attacks are magical. When the general hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Juggernaut
entries: A weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the general hits with it (included in the attack). The general deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Pain Indifference
entries: The general's AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The general can use its Booming Teleport or Inspire Dread. It then makes two maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the general's next turn.

action.name: Booming Teleport
entries: The general, along with any objects it is wearing or carrying, teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 5 feet of the general before it teleports must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the creature takes half the force damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Inspire Dread (Recharges 5-6)
entries: The general exudes magical terror. Any creature hostile to the general within 30 feet of the general must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for l minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. If a {@condition frightened} target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the general, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The general's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18). The general can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The warrior's weapon attacks are magical. When the warrior hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: War Magic (Honor Guard Only)
entries: When a member of the honor guard uses its action to cast a cantrip, it can also take a bonus action to make one weapon attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@dice 2d6 + 3}) plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@dice 1d10 + 3}) plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

reaction.name: Arcane Rush
entries: After a magical teleport the warrior can make one melee weapon attack with advantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warrior's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). The rider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting (Honor Guard Only)
headerEntries: While members of the honor guard are within 60 feet of a navigator, they can each cast the following spells but must share the daily uses among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, each member of the honor guard is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Charisma as its spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the member's Charisma modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the member's Charisma modifier.

variant.name: Corsair
entries: Corsairs spend most of their time on naglfar ships, sailing the Astral Sea and honing their skills in skirmishes against githyanki warriors, githzekai monks and other creatures of this dangerous plane. A corsair has a challenge rating of 5 (1,800 XP) and the following additional traits:

entries.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: On its turn, the corsair can take one additional action and a possible bonus action.

entries.name: Endless Hunt (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the corsair takes damage that reduces it to 0 hit points, it immediately regains 20 hit points.
Honor Guard. A corsair that is part of the honor guard (see the "Honor Guard" sidebar, in the Navigator section) has a challenge rating of 7 (2,900 XP).

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The hound can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Ice Spikes (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The hound magically summons ice spikes out of the ground. Each creature within 5 feet of the hound of the wild hunt must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Deadly Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the ice wraith can make a Freezing Bite attack as a bonus action and has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the ice wraith is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Snowy Stealth
entries: While in a snowy environment, the ice wraith has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Freezing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, or for 1 minute, take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns, its speed is halved; it can take either an action or a bonus action on each of its turns, not both; and it can't take reactions. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Slither Away
entries: The ice wraith adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the ice wraith must see the attacker. If the attack misses, the ice wraith moves up to its speed and doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Etherealness
entries: As a bonus action, the jörmungandr magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the jörmungandr is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Snowy Stealth
entries: While in a snowy environment, the jörmungandr has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jörmungandr makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Freezing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, or for 1 minute, take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage at start of each of its turns, its speed is halved; it can take either an action or a bonus action on each of its turns, not both; and it can't take reactions. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Ouroboros (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The jörmungandr bites its own tail and start spinning on itself, opening a rift of supernatural frost to the Frostfell. Each creature within 10 feet of the jörmungandr must succeed on a DC 15 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target' s choice) or be trapped by the rift. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. If the target is killed by this damage, it becomes a frozen statue in the Frostfell. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The target remains there until the effect ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

trait.name: Detect Heat
entries: The elemental can magically sense the presence of heat sources, including warm-blooded creatures, up to 5 miles away. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Drain Warmth
entries: When a creature of the elemental's choice starts its turn within 60 feet of the elemental, the elemental can force the creature to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw if the elemental isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature has vulnerability to cold damage for 1 minute, until it has immunity to cold damage. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the elemental's Drain Warmth for the next 24 hours. A lesser restoration spell ends this effect.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Hurl Ice
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Detect Heat
entries: The elemental can magically sense the presence of heat sources, including warm-blooded creatures, up to 5 miles away. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Drain Warmth
entries: When a creature of the elemental's choice starts its turn within 60 feet of the elemental, the elemental can force the creature to make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw if the elemental isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature has vulnerability to cold damage for 1 minute, until it has immunity to cold damage. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the elemental's Drain Warmth for the next 24 hours. A lesser restoration spell ends this effect.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks, and uses its Freeze Heart if it can.

action.name: Hurl Ice
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Freeze Heart (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The elemental targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that isn't an undead, elemental or construct. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the creature is cursed with Soul Torment (see Appendix).

reaction.name: Condemn Fire
entries: The elemental can force a creature within 60 feet of it that is casting a spell that can deal fire damage to make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} cold damage per level of the spell, and the spell has no effect and is wasted.

reaction.name: Heinous Reprisal
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack that deals fire damage, the elemental can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

variant.name: Hjarthane
entries: An elemetal can gain power from a pact with a navigator. A hjarthane has a challenge rating of 12 (8,400 XP) and the following additional traits:

entries.name: Hjarthane Bound
entries: The elemental is magically bound to a navigator. As long as the navigator and its hjarthane are on the same plane of existence, the navigator can telepathically call the hjarthane to travel to it, and the hjarthane knows the distance and direction to the navigator. If the hjarthane is within 60 feet of the navigator, half of any damage the navigator takes (rounded up) is transferred to the hjarthane.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: The hjarthane regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the hjarthane takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the hjarthane's next turn. The hjarthane is killed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

monster.name: Arch-wraith
languages: the languages it knew in life
telepathy limitless in its Domain of Dread

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The wraith can magically sense the presence of living creatures anywhere in its Domain of Dread. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The wraith is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three attacks, only one of which can be a Grave's Touch attack.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}32 ({@damage 5d8 + 10}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Grave's Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) cold damage and the target's must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, becoming petrified, encased in ice, until the end of its next turn on a failure.

action.name: Ray of Decay
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Ray of Decay
entries: The wraith uses its Ray of Decay.

legendary.name: Whirlwind (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The arch-wraith turns into a frigid whirlwind, draining away the life of nearby creatures. All creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

legendary.name: Dead Silence (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The arch-wraith can rob a creature within 120 feet of it from its senses, leaving it in pitch-black darkness. The creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw, becoming blinded and deafened on failure for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Cenokian Wraith
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Faces of Terror
entries: Any creature who targets the wraith with an attack or a harmful spell must first succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Forbiddance
entries: The wraith can't enter a residence if its owner has marked the main door with lamb's blood.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three spectral claw attacks.

action.name: Spectral Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) necrotic damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

action.name: Absorb Soul
entries: The wraith chooses a living humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 5 feet of it. The target's soul is magically trapped inside the wraith, the wraith regains 20 hit points, immediately recharges Death Grasp, and gains an additional action on its next turn. While the soul is trapped, the target's body and all the equipment it is carrying cease to exist. The soul is freed if the wraith drops to 0 hit points, or the wraith frees it as an action, at which point the target's body reforms in an unoccupied space nearest to the wraith and in the same state as when it was trapped.

action.name: Death Grasp (Recharges 5-6)
entries: The wraith reaches into the body of a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 47 ({@damage 6d8 + 20}) necrotic damage. On a failed save, the target drops to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Death Mark
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed until the end of the wraith's next turn. Until the curse ends, the target is vulnerable to necrotic damage and can't regain hit points.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The wraith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Insanity (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one frightened creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the wraith, it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and gain a random form of short-term madness (roll on the Short-Term Madness table in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) for 1 minute. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the madness.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Etherealness
entries: The wraith enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa with a bonus action. The wraith is invisible while on the Border Ethereal and it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shadow Being
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the wraith has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three attacks, one with its sapping tether and two with its shadow claws.

action.name: Shadow Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Sapping Tether
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) psychic damage and the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target gains a hym's indefinite madness if this reduces its Wisdom to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

legendary.name: Shadow Step
entries: The wraith magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the next melee attack before the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Torment (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets on creatures with hym's indefinite madness that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Rip Shadow (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one Medium or smaller creature that casts a shadow. The target's shadow must be visible to the wraith and within 30 feet of it. If the target fails a DC 17 Charisma saving throw, its shadow detaches from it and becomes a shadow that obeys the wraith's commands, acting on the initiative count of the wraith. A greater restoration spell or a remove curse spell cast on the target restores its natural shadow, but only if its undead shadow has been destroyed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wraith's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The wraith can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monster.name: Nightwraith

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Moonlight Dance
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the wraith that can see it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed, joining the wraith in its maddening dance. The creature is free from the enchantment if it takes any damage. Each hour passed dancing, the creature gains one level of exhaustion. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw each hour, with disadvantage if the wraith is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the nightwraith's Moonlight Dance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The wraith takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Deathly Projection (2/Day)
entries: The wraith creates 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) duplicates specter of itself that appear in an unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. It can also turn invisible until it attacks, either before or after it creates the specters. The wraith regains hit points equal to the damage inflicted by the specters.

monster.name: Noonwraith

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Midday Dance
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the wraith that can see it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed, joining the wraith in its maddening dance. The creature is free from the enchantment if it takes any damage. Each hour passed dancing, the creature gains one level of exhaustion. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw each hour, with disadvantage if the wraith is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the noonwraith's Midday Dance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Moonlight Sensitivity
entries: At night, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken and the wraith regains hit points equal to that amount. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Searing Heat (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The wraith wraps heat and dust around her. Every creature within 20 feet of the wraith must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save and being blinded until the end of their next turn. Creatures take half as much damage on a successful saving throw and are not blinded.

monster.name: Oracula

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Catoptric Travel
entries: When the wraith is within 5 feet of a reflective surface that it can see, it can use a bonus action to shift to the Material Plane, the Ethereal Plane, or its demiplane. When it would enter the Ethereal Plane, it can instead immediately appear in front of a different reflective surface that it can see in the Material Plane if that mirror is within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Mirror Bound
entries: On the Material Plane, the wraith can only move within the span of reflection of reflective surfaces, such as mirrors, still pools, and polished steel, that are at least a square foot. If it is more than 30 feet away from any such surface, the wraith immediately shifts to the Ethereal Plane.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith can use its Eye Bleed and makes two mirror shard attacks.

action.name: Mirror Shard
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eye Bleed
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the wraith's eyes, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage and be permanently blinded.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The wraith flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Prison of Mirrors (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Every creature the wraith can see within 30 feet of a mirror at least 4 feet tall must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be magically shifted to the wraith's demiplane.

legendary.name: Death Omen (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target is affected as if by the enemies abound spell, seeing all creatures as threatening undead. In addition, the target dies if it drops to 0 hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

monster.name: Pesta

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Deceitful Mask
entries: As a bonus action, the wraith can mask its appearance and appear to be any kind of ghost, specter or wraith. In addition, the wraith changes the way it appears to spells and magical effects that detect creature types, such as a paladin's Divine Sense. It chooses a creature type and other spells and magical effects treat it as if it were a creature of that type or of that alignment. This magical illusion lasts until it ends it as a bonus action. The effect also ends if the wraith drops to 50 hit points or fewer, or if dispel magic is cast on it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wraith regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the wraith takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of the wraith's next turn.

trait.name: Supernatural Plague
entries: The wraith contains all diseases that ever existed, aggravated by its nature. All are magical diseases and affect creatures immune to nonmagical disease. A lesser restoration spell or similar magic casted on a creature affected with a disease of the wraith can remove it only if the caster succeeds on a DC 15 ability check using its spellcasting ability.

action.name: Plague Caress
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw, its hit point maximum is reduced for 1 hour by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it took. Any effect that removes a disease allows a creature's hit point maximum to return to normal before that time passes.

action.name: Pestilential Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The wraith exhales a 60-foot cone of flies and noxious gas. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 56 ({@damage 16d6}) poison damage and be infected with a disease. This plague ravages an infected creature's body, killing the creature in a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d12} + the creature's Constitution score, unless the disease is removed. On a successful save, a creature takes half the poison damage and isn't diseased.

legendary.name: Affliction
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is infected with a disease. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. A humanoid slain by this attack rises as an undead at the start of its next turn. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 Hit Dice or more, it becomes a rotfiend.

legendary.name: Flare-Up Disease
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is infected with a disease. The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Vermin Cloud (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith releases a cloud of insects that fills a 15-foot·radius sphere centered on itself. The cloud lingers until the end of the wraith's next turn. The cloud is opaque. Any creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours.

monster.name: Shade

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The shade can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shadow Shroud
entries: As a bonus action, the shade magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to a space it can see. It can also turn invisible until it attacks, either before or after it teleports. If the shade takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the end of the shade's next turn.

trait.name: Shade Weaknesses
entries: The shade has the following flaws:

{@i Repelled by Salt} The shade can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means. If the shade tries to use teleportation to do so, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. Whether or not the attempt is successful, the shade takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity} The shade takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. If the shade had advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Shade Host
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The shade host can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The shade host takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The shade host can't gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Howling Hatred
entries: The shade host emits a horrific howl while it can see any living creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the shade host and can hear the howl must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

While frightened in this way, the creature rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature drops whatever it is holding and must move at least 30 feet away from the shade host, if able. On a 5 or 6, the creature is stunned until the start of its next turn. On a 7 or 8, the creature is overwhelmed with despair until the start of its next turn. During this time, it can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade host can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shade Host Weaknesses
entries: The shade host has the following flaws:
{@i Repelled by Salt} The shade host can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity} The shade host takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade host makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Create Specter
entries: The shade host targets a humanoid within its space that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter that becomes part of the shade host, the shade host regains 22 ({@dice 5d8}) hit points. While the specter is part of the shade host, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.

monster.name: Bloated Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the zombie is destroyed, it explodes in a burst of acid and guts. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Spew Bile (recharge 5-6)
entries: The zombie spews bile in 15-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Feral Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the zombie can move up to half its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Horde of Zombies
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Plagued
entries: When the swarm hits with an attack, it deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Undead Swarm Fortitude
entries: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horde uses its pull under ability if able, then uses its gnaw and claw attack.

action.name: Gnaw and Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Pull Under
entries: The horde attempts to envelope a creature within its space. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and considered grappled (escape DC 13) as they are pinned to the ground under a sea of zombies. This ability can only be used if the horde is above half of its maximum hit points.

monster.name: Ravenous Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The zombie has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Herald of Decay
entries: All food and liquid within 60 feet of the zombie spoils instantly. Rations turn bad, meat rots, bread becomes stale and water becomes unsafe to drink. Small nonmagical plants wither and die, while trees become sick and start to rot. Perishables protected by air-sealed containers are unaffected.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Voracious Aura
entries: Any living creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the zombie or enters the affected area for the first time on a turn must succeed a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 7 ({@dice 2d6}), and the zombie regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two unarmed strike attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the zombie can grapple the target (escape DC 14).

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is grappled by the zombie, incapacitated or restrained. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage. A creature taking damage from the attack suffers from a lingering injury (p.272 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: All zombies within 5 miles of the shambling lord are tied into an instinctive hive mind, linked to the lord. Within the range of the telepathic bond, the shambling lord can see through the eyes of any zombie, hear what it hears and speak through it. It can cast spells as though it were in the zombie's space, and can mentally command any zombie within reach (if it controls multiple creatures, it can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shambling lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The zombie regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the zombie takes radiant damage or a critical hit, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zombie's next turn. The shambling lord is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Well of Knowledge
entries: The shambling lord can recollect all the knowledges and memories stored in the collective hive mind of its hordes or the brains it devoured. It has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom skill checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling lord uses its Shambling Hordes feature, if available, and makes two unarmed strike attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Psychic Assault
entries: The shambling lord magically assault the mind of three targets it can see within 90 feet of it. A target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also stunned until the end of the zombie's next turn.

action.name: Shambling Hordes (recharge 5-6)
entries: The shambling lord can summon one horde of zombies, a summoned horde appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the shambling lord, acting as an ally. It remains for l minute, until it or the shambling lord dies, or until the shambling lord dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The shambling lord's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). The zombie can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Frenzied
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the swarm does nothing this turn.

entries.name: Sacrifice
entries: When the swarm hits a Medium or smaller target with a melee weapon attack, it is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the swarm can automatically hit the target with its melee weapon attacks. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points while grappled by the swarm.

entries.name: Open the Gate
entries: The swarm reduces itself to 0 hit points, summoning a fiend or aberration creature of challenge rating equal to its own or lower, or half of its challenge rating (rounded up) if it has half of its hit points or fewer. The creature appears in an unoccupied space within the swarm's space. The summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Bad Omens
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm has a speed of 0 and has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Burn the Heretics
entries: While inside the swarm's space, any creature that tries to cast a spell must avoid the wrath of the fanatics. The creature can choose another action, but if it tries to cast the spell, it must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d6 fire damage per level of the spell, and the spell has no effect and is wasted.

entries.name: Purified by Fire
entries: When the swarm hits with any weapon, if the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Reactive
entries: The swarm can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

entries.name: Unruly
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The swarm doesn't take an action this turn.

entries.name: Countercharge
entries: In response to a creature entering its reach, the swarm can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

entries.name: Impetuous
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move toward the nearest and most obvious seat of power. The swarm moves toward the seat of power by the most direct route.

entries.name: Sworn Enemy
entries: The swarm has a sworn enemy, which include every identified member of an organization or government. When the swarm makes a melee or ranged attack roll against its sworn enemy, it has advantage on the roll. In addition, its target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover. If the attack hits, the sworn enemy takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage.

entries.name: Destructive
entries: The swarm deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Inspirational Ideals (Recharge 4-6}
entries: Up to three allies within 120 feet of the swarm that can hear it can use their reactions to be freed from any charm and fright effect.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: The swarm has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries: The swarm makes three improvised weapons attacks.

entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The swarm doesn't take an action this turn.

entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move toward the nearest and most obvious seat of power. The swarm moves toward the seat of power by the most direct route.

entries: The swarm has a sworn enemy, which include every identified member of an organization or government. When the swarm makes a melee or ranged attack roll against its sworn enemy, it has advantage on the roll. In addition, its target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover. If the attack hits, the sworn enemy takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage.

entries.name: Destructive
entries: The swarm deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Inspirational Ideals (Recharge 4-6}
entries: Up to three allies within 120 feet of the swarm that can hear it can use their reactions to be freed from any charm and fright effect.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the berserker hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Islander's Fortitude (2/Day)
entries: If damage reduces the berserker to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the berserker drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The berserker can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The berserker is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the berserker is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Unbridled Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the berserker can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the berserker is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the berserker gains the following benefits:

items: The berserker has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the berserker gains a +3 bonus to the damage roll.
The berserker has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Retaliation
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the berserker can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

reaction.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: When a creature the berserker can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the berserker, the berserker can intimidate it. If the creature can see the berserker, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of berserker's next turn.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The warrior has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The warrior can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The warrior is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the warrior can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warrior makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Boarding Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 12) and pulled 10 feet toward the warrior. If this bring the {@condition grappled} creature within 5 feet of the warrior, the warrior can make a melee weapon attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the huskarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Deadly Strike (1/Turn)
entries: Any hit with a melee weapon attack the huskarl scores against a {@condition prone} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The huskarl can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The huskarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The huskarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The huskarl makes either three melee attacks—two with its longsword and one with its spiked shield—or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spiked Shield
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Bulwark
entries: When an ally the huskarl can see within 5 feet of it is attacked, the huskarl switches places with the ally. The two ally swap places, and the huskarl becomes the target instead.

trait.name: First Axe
entries: A weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the jarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The jarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The jarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The jarl regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jarl makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the jarl scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jarl adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jarl must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Encourage
entries: The jarl encourages one ally it can see within 60 feet of it. The ally has advantage on attack rolls it makes until the start of the jarl's next turn, provided it can hear the jarl.

legendary.name: Deathblow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The jarl makes one weapon attack. If it hits, the attack deals maximum damage and the target can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Unleash the Fury (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Up to three friendly creature within 120 feet of the jarl that can hear it can use their reactions to move up to their speed and each make one weapon attack.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The raider can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The northlander is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Battleaxe or Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Wall of Shields
entries: When the raider is within 5 feet of a creature that has the Mariner trait and is bearing a shield, it can use their reaction to make a wall of shields. The involved raider and creature gain half cover, provided they are bearing a shield.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The maiden can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The maiden can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The maiden is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maiden makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: When a creature misses the maiden with a melee weapon attack, the maiden can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The skald has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The skald can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The skald is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Shout of Valor (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The skald can utter a powerful warcry. For 1 minute, whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a damage roll. The creature can add a {@dice d6} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the skald. A creature can benefit from only one Shout of Valor die at a time. This effect ends if the skald is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skald makes two melee attacks or two ranged attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: War Horn (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The skald blows in its horn. Each hostile creature within 120 feet of the skald that can hear it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the skald's next turn or until the skald is {@condition incapacitated}. A {@condition frightened} target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the skald must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the skald as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the safest available route away from the skald. A target that successfully saves is immune to the War Horn of all skalds for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the thane hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
entries: The thane can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The thane can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The thane is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.
