trait.name: Martial Superiority (1/Turn)
entries: The thane can deal an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the thane can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thane makes three melee attacks: one with its battleaxe and two with its longsword.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the thane scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The thane makes one longsword attack.

legendary.name: Command Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the target can move up to its speed as a reaction.

legendary.name: Inspire Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the creature gains 20 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Rally Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, it is freed from any charm and fright effect.

legendary.name: Rush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The thane moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and slams into it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the heir can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Ancestor's Protection
entries: The heir has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the heir. If the heir's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 7th level or lower, the heir is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the heir, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the heir hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The heir's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The heir can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The heir is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the heir is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Unbridled Rage
entries: As a bonus action, the heir can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts until the heir is {@condition incapacitated} or choose to end it. While raging, the heir gains the following benefits:

items: The heir has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the heir gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The heir has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heir makes two melee attacks or four melee attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining. On a hit, the heir can cause an additional effect, choosing from the options below (each effect can be used only once per turn):
The attack deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) slashing damage.
The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the northlander's next turn.
The attack bypass the damage resistances of the target.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Lore Keeper
entries: The völva has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The völva can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The völva is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Seeress
entries: The völva can't be surprised and attack rolls against her have disadvantage unless the völva is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. While the völva is wearing no armor, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Wand-Wed
entries: The völva carries a staff carved out of the wood of a mystical white tree, that is a focus for her inner power. She can use the staff as if it were a staff of healing (Wisdom spellcasting ability). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the völva must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a völva can use the staff.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 (l{@dice d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (l{@dice d8 - 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Tormenting Vision
entries: The völva targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is under one of the following effects, chosen by the völva:

items: The target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of the völva's next turn.

On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.
The target is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: The King in Green (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the king can enter a blessed state at the start of his turn. The blessing lasts for 1 minute or until the king is {@condition incapacitated}. While blessed, the king gains the following benefits:

items: The king sheds bright green light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Any creature in the area of the light can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.
The king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
When the king makes a Charisma or Strength check, he can replace the number he rolls with a 15.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: When the king hits with a melee weapon, it deals one extra die of the weapon's damage, plus an additional 6 damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king makes three solais attacks.

action.name: Solais
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d6 + 13}) slashing damage. Solais is a +3 silvered magic weapon.

action.name: Blessed Fury (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The king uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage of the following types (king's choice): lightning, radiant, or thunder.

reaction.name: Goddess' Protection
entries: In response to being hit by an attack, the king reduces the damage to 0 and each creature within 5 feet of the king takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: King's Blessing
entries: The king bestows his blessing on one ally he can see within 30 feet of him. The ally has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws it makes until the start of the king's next turn.

legendary.name: Imperious Blow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The king makes a Solais attack. If it hits, the target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the king until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Word of Peace (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The king speaks with the voice of the goddess. Each creature within 30 feet of the king that can hear him must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for an hour. While {@condition charmed} by the king, a creature becomes indifferent about creatures that it is hostile toward. A creature is no longer {@condition charmed} if it is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the effect ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the king's Word of Peace for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric and druid spells prepared:
footerEntries: 1st Level (4 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds
2nd Level (3 slots): healing spirit, spiritual weapon
3rd Level (3 slots): erupting earth, spirit guardians
5th Level (2 slots): commune, wrath of nature
6th Level (1 slot): conjure fey, druid grove

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Spirit Shape
entries: As a bonus action, the druid can magically shift to the Ethereal Plane. At the start of its next turn, it returns to the Material Plane in an unoccupied space that it can see within 30 feet of the space it vanished from.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Brand of the Prey
entries: The druid targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, beast, fey, and plant creatures are hostile to the target and have advantage on attack rolls made against it. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The fianna can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The fianna also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Harrier
entries: When the fianna makes a melee attack against a creature, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hits or not.

trait.name: Opportunist
entries: The fianna deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with an opportunity attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fianna makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Artisan
entries: The islander has proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of its choice.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The islander can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The islander also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: War Hound
entries: As a bonus action, the islander can command an ally {@creature mastiff} that can hear it to use its reaction to move up to its speed and make one bite attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Channel Aspect
entries: As a bonus action at the start of its turn, the leathdhia can magically channel an aspect of the goddess. The aspect lasts until the leathdhia is {@condition incapacitated}, channels another aspect, or chooses to end it. While channeling, the leathdhia gains one of the following benefits of its choice:

trait.name: Badb
entries: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the leathdhia.

trait.name: Da Dhiogail
entries: Attack rolls against the leathdhia have disadvantage, unless the leathdhia is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Earthmother
entries: The leathdhia can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The leathdhia takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Divine Conduit
entries: The leathdhia can cast commune at will. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma.

trait.name: Threefold Death
entries: If damage reduces the leathdhia to 0 hit points, the leathdhia drops to 1 hit point instead. If the leathdhia is reduced to 0 hit points three times on the same turn, this trait doesn't function.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leathdhia makes two attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Storm of War (Badb Aspect Only)
entries: The leathdhia creates bolts of lightning, which can strike up to three targets the leathdhia can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The leathdhia makes one attack.

legendary.name: Silver Mist (Earthmother Aspect Only)
entries: A silvery mist conceals the leathdhia, turning it {@condition invisible} until it attacks. While {@condition invisible}, the leathdhia has resistance to all damage.

legendary.name: Cursed Wail (Da Dhiogail Aspect Only, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The leathdhia releases a blood-curling wail. Each creature hostile to the leathdhia within 30 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has vulnerability to all damage. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Ocean's Roar (Badb Aspect Only, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The leathdhia spews out a wave of water. The wave can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 30 feet of it, and then vanishes.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the macnia hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Exemplary
entries: A macnia's allied creature can't be {@condition frightened} while it can see the macnia within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The macnia can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The macnia also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Quickening
entries: As a bonus action, the macnia can add {@dice 1d10} to its next attack or damage roll with a greatsword.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The macnia makes three greatsword attacks or three longbow attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Duelist
entries: The macnia adds {@dice 1d10} to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the macnia must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses as a result, the macnia can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The noble can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The noble also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Might of the Goddess
entries: Once per turn, the noble can deal an extra 22 ({@dice 5d8}) damage of one of the following types (noble's choice) to a creature it hits with a melee weapon attack: lightning, radiant, or thunder.

trait.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: When the noble hits with a melee weapon, it deals one extra die of the weapon's damage, plus an additional 4 damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The noble makes three oathblade attacks.

action.name: Oathblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage, or 19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) slashing damage if used with two hands. The oathblade is a silvered magic weapon.

reaction.name: Goddess' Presence
entries: The noble grants advantage to a saving throw made by itself or another creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The noble can make this choice after the roll is made but before it succeeds or fails.

trait.name: Beast Bond
entries: The ranger can cast beast bond at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Wisdom.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The ranger can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The ranger also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ranger makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned}, the target is unable to breath. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each minute that elapses, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Skirmisher
entries: The ranger moves up to half its speed when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of it. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Demented Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the fury can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the fury is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the fury gains the following benefits:

items: The speed of the fury increases by 30 feet and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
Attack rolls against the fury have disadvantage, unless the fury is {@condition incapacitated}.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the fury gains a +3 bonus to the damage roll.

trait.name: Merciless
entries: The fury has advantage on melee attack rolls against a {@condition frightened} creature.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the fury is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Wailing Charge
entries: If the fury moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target, and then hits that target with a melee weapon attack, the target is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fury makes two longsword attacks, or four longsword attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining. If Cursed Wail is available to use, the fury can use it before or after these attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Cursed Wail (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The fury releases a bloodcurling wail. Each creature hostile to the fury within 30 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has vulnerability to all damage. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the curse ends for it, the creature is immune to the fury's Wail for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric and druid spells prepared:
footerEntries: 2nd Level (3 slots): hold person, scorching ray
3rd Level (3 slots): call lightning, tidal wave

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Litany of War
entries: When the druid uses its action to cast a spell or take the Attack action, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

trait.name: War Magic
entries: When the druid uses its action to cast a spell, it can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Woad War Paint
entries: When the druid is reduced to 0 hit points, reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points or scores a critical hit, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The druid makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Garden of Badb
entries: Badb is war and war is Badb. When the enemy's blood flows in her name, the goddess takes notice and reward her warriors with exalted powers, turning them into her instrument of destruction. Creatures that have the {@b Woad War Paint trait} (refered as painted for this sidebar) can take the following legendary actions:

entries.name: Shared Legendary Actions
entries: Painted can take legendary actions, choosing from the options below, but must share the actions among themselves. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Legendary actions are only available if a creature generates one with a power and are all lost at the end of the combat encounter.

entries.name: Goddess' Guidance
entries: The painted makes a melee weapon attack with advantage. If it hits, the painted gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The painted can magically end the charmed and frightened conditions on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Flock of Doom (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted summons one primal murder of crows, which appears within 30 feet of it in an unoccupied space it can see. The swarm obeys its summoner's commands and can't be controlled by any other creature. The swarm vanishes when it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Mist of the Isles (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted and each creatures of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it magically turn invisible until the end of the painted's next turn.

entries.name: Shroud of Badb (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The painted is immune to all damage and conditions until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: War is Eternal (Cost 3 Actions)
entries: The painted targets one dead humanoid that has died within the last round it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is revived with all its hit points.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The reaver can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The reaver also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Reckless Charge
entries: If the reaver moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target, it has advantage on its next melee weapon attack roll against that target.

trait.name: Woad War Paint
entries: When the reaver is reduced to 0 hit points, reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points or scores a critical hit, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

action.name: Battleaxe or Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Garden of Badb
entries: Badb is war and war is Badb. When the enemy's blood flows in her name, the goddess takes notice and reward her warriors with exalted powers, turning them into her instrument of destruction. Creatures that have the {@b Woad War Paint trait} (refered as painted for this sidebar) can take the following legendary actions:

entries.name: Shared Legendary Actions
entries: Painted can take legendary actions, choosing from the options below, but must share the actions among themselves. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Legendary actions are only available if a creature generates one with a power and are all lost at the end of the combat encounter.

entries.name: Goddess' Guidance
entries: The painted makes a melee weapon attack with advantage. If it hits, the painted gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The painted can magically end the charmed and frightened conditions on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Flock of Doom (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted summons one primal murder of crows, which appears within 30 feet of it in an unoccupied space it can see. The swarm obeys its summoner's commands and can't be controlled by any other creature. The swarm vanishes when it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Mist of the Isles (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted and each creatures of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it magically turn invisible until the end of the painted's next turn.

entries.name: Shroud of Badb (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The painted is immune to all damage and conditions until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: War is Eternal (Cost 3 Actions)
entries: The painted targets one dead humanoid that has died within the last round it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is revived with all its hit points.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the whaler hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The whaler can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The whaler also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Woad War Paint
entries: When the whaler is reduced to 0 hit points, reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points or scores a critical hit, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whaler makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Barbed Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/100 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 14). While {@condition grappled} in this way, a creature's speed isn't reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the whaler. A creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. As a bonus action, the whaler can pull a creature {@condition grappled} by it 20 feet closer. The whaler can grapple only one creature at a time.

action.name: Gutting Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the target is {@condition grappled} with a barbed harpoon.

variant.name: Garden of Badb
entries: Badb is war and war is Badb. When the enemy's blood flows in her name, the goddess takes notice and reward her warriors with exalted powers, turning them into her instrument of destruction. Creatures that have the {@b Woad War Paint trait} (refered as painted for this sidebar) can take the following legendary actions:

entries.name: Shared Legendary Actions
entries: Painted can take legendary actions, choosing from the options below, but must share the actions among themselves. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Legendary actions are only available if a creature generates one with a power and are all lost at the end of the combat encounter.

entries.name: Goddess' Guidance
entries: The painted makes a melee weapon attack with advantage. If it hits, the painted gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The painted can magically end the charmed and frightened conditions on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Flock of Doom (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted summons one primal murder of crows, which appears within 30 feet of it in an unoccupied space it can see. The swarm obeys its summoner's commands and can't be controlled by any other creature. The swarm vanishes when it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Mist of the Isles (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted and each creatures of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it magically turn invisible until the end of the painted's next turn.

entries.name: Shroud of Badb (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The painted is immune to all damage and conditions until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: War is Eternal (Cost 3 Actions)
entries: The painted targets one dead humanoid that has died within the last round it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is revived with all its hit points.

trait.name: Alchemic Blood
entries: When the alkahzir takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the alkazir takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the alkahzir fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Phenomenal Mithridatism
entries: After taking damage, the alkahzir gains immunity to damage of that type, except psychic damage, until the start of its next turn. If the alkahzir's takes extra damage from the Philosopher's Stone trait, this trait doesn't function until the start of the alkahzir's next turn.

trait.name: Philosopher's Stone
entries: Once per round when the alkahzir is attacked by a creature, the attacker can target the philosopher's stone trapped in it. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 11 ({@dice 2d10}) damage to the alkahzir, and the alkahzir gains an additional action on its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alkahzir makes two alkahest dissolution attacks.

action.name: Debilitate
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or be debilitated by disease. The diseased creature can't regain hit points, and has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

action.name: Alkahest Dissolution
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}66 ({@damage 12d10}) acid damage. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

action.name: Shape Materia
entries: The alkahzir performs a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of wood, stone, or metal, transforming it into a different one of those materials. For each round it spends performing the procedure, it can transform 2 cubic foot of material, up to a 20-foot cube. If it concentrates on this effect for 1 minute, (as if it were concentrating on a spell), the transformation becomes permanent, otherwise the material reverts instantly to its original substance.

action.name: Aetheric Blaze (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The alkahzir agitates matter in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage and 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Debilitate
entries: The alkahzir makes one debilitate attack.

legendary.name: Azoth Transitory Shape (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The alkahzir targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or be transformed for 1 minute into a gaseous, liquid, or solid form (the alkahzir's choice), unless it is a shapechanger. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the effect lasts for the full duration, the transformation becomes permanent. Only a wish spell can reverse the permanent transformation.

While transformed, the creature can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. A creature's statistics, other than its speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It is immune to all nonmagical damage. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

In gaseous form, the target is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the creature can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water.

In liquid form, the target's walking speed becomes 0, it has a swimming speed of 20 feet, and it can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can breathe air and water and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
In solid form, the target is {@condition petrified}.

legendary.name: Artificial Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The alkahzir touches the corpse of a Medium humanoid within 5 feet of it, causing it to become a flesh golem (see the Monster Manual for its stat block) for 1 hour. If the alkahzir gives the golem no commands, it does nothing but follow the alkahzir and take the Dodge action.

trait.name: Quick Quaffer
entries: The alchemist can drink a potion as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The alchemist has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Volatile Mix
entries: The alchemist throws a flask at a solid surface within 40 feet of it, where the flask detonates. Roll a {@dice d4} or choose one of the following options:

1. Choker's Dust. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or choke for 1 minute. While choking, a creature is running out of breath and can't speak or cast spells with verbal components. A choking creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

2. Devil's Puffball. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

3. Samum. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of the alchemist's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

4. Vitriol. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage and takes 5 acid damage at the start of each of its turns. Dousing the target with water reduces the acid damage by 1 point per pint or flask of water used. If the saving throw is successful, the creature takes half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its turns.

reaction.name: Smoke Bomb (Recharge 5-6)
entries: In response to taking damage, the alchemist drops a smoke bomb, releasing a cloud of smoke that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Wind disperses the cloud, which otherwise lasts for 1 minute.

variant.name: Forgotten Formulas
entries: Most alchemist do not know the secrets of these formulas, but a few have rediscovered them in ancient treatises. Feel free to add some or all of them to symbolize the alchemist's progression :

entries.name: Dream Gas
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. A creature awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it.

entries.name: Ethera
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or gain the effect of the etherealness spell until the end of the alchemist's next turn.

entries.name: Northern Wind
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage and is {@condition restrained} in ice until the end of the alchemist's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Dermal Adaptation
entries: After taking damage, the experimenter gains resistance to damage of that type, except psychic damage, until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Inner Alchemy
entries: The numerical effects and duration of potions (such as a potion of healing or a potion of speed) used by the experimenter are doubled.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The experimenter has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The experimenter makes three ranged attacks or three melee attacks,

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Injector
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer one random poison effect:
1. Poison Damage: The target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) poison damage.
2. Paralysis: The target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

3. Organ Failure: The target is {@condition poisoned}, which causes it to also gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it , and ending the poison removes any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by it. Each failed save causes the target to suffer another level of {@condition exhaustion}.

variant.name: Elixirs and Serums
entries: Experimenters come to develop their own elixirs and serums. An experimenter with Kadon's Transmogrifying Serum has a challenge rating of 11 (7,200 XP). Add some of the following ones to illustrate an experimenter's progression:

entries.name: White Raffard's Elixir (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the experimenter can regain 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points and is freed from any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

entries.name: Golden Oriole Elixir (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, whenever the experimenter is subjected to poison damage within the next minute, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the poison damage dealt.

entries.name: Kadon's Transmogrifying Serum (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the experimenter assume a muscular and hideous form for 1 hour. While transformed, the experimenter gains the following benefits:

items: Its size becomes Large.
It regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if
it has at least 1 hit point.
It has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws.
It has a Strength of 20 (+5).
It gains the following additional action option:

entries.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the magister fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Perfect Metal
entries: While the magister wears armor made of metal, its AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The magister has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The magister makes three attacks: two with its metal shard and one with its golden phial, and uses Rust Breeze, if it is available.

action.name: Metal Shard
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Golden Phial
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) acid damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw against being {@condition petrified}. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to gold and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} for 1 hour.

action.name: Rust Breeze (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The magister blows rust powder in a 15-foot cone. Each creature wearing metal armor in that area must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 31 ({@damage 7d8}) piercing damage and be {@condition restrained} in their armor for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Unravel the Craft
entries: When the magister is hit by a metal weapon, it touches the weapon, destroying it if it is nonmagical. If it is a magic weapon that isn't an artifact, its properties are suppressed for 10 minutes.

legendary.name: Heat Metal
entries: The magister casts heat metal (spell save DC 19). Intelligence is its spellcasting ability for this spell.

legendary.name: Final Transformation (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The magister touches one {@condition petrified} creature within 5 feet of it. The creature takes 66 ({@damage 12d10}) acid damage, ignoring resistance to damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the creature is killed by turning into molten gold.

legendary.name: Gilded Form (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The magister becomes {@condition petrified}, turning into gold until the start of its next turn. While {@condition petrified} by this effect, the magister is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

legendary.name: Blade Barrier (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The magister casts blade barrier (spell save DC 19). Intelligence is its spellcasting ability for this spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The abomination's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18). The abomination can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The abomination has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft ., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Balefire Burst
entries: The abomination targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) acid damage plus 31 ({@damage 7d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Flames of Change (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The abomination uses Balefire Burst, and on a failed save, the creature is also warped with magical deformities. While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on any ability check, saving throw, and attack that uses Strength or Dexterity. If the deformed creature dies, it instantly transforms into a living warp spawn. The deformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration spell or similar magic can end the deformation. The transformation of the body into a warp spawn can be undone only by a wish spell.

monster.name: Lodestar
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Erode Sanity
entries: Whenever a creature fails an Intelligence or Wisdom saving throw while within 120 feet of the lodestar, note that fact. When such a creature finishes its next short or long rest, it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or gain a form of madness from the Dungeon Master's Guide as shown below:

trait.name: Warpstar
entries: The lodestar sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Every creature within the light has disadvantage on saving throws. Aberrations within the light, including the lodestar, have advantage on saving throws instead.

entries.caption: Terms of the Bargain
rows: Short-term
Long-term
Indefinite

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lodestar makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its reaching tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +9 to it, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Reaching Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} +9 to it, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 17) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and it takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns. The lodestar can grapple up to two creatures at one time.

action.name: Sing the Eldritch Truth (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The lodestar targets one humanoid it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save behaves as if under the effects of the confusion spell during combat, can't understand language, and if its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become 5. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or remove curse spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

monster.name: Obscuroth
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The obscuroth has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Mimetic Skin
entries: The obscuroth is {@condition invisible} while in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Mind Hunter (1/Turn)
entries: When the obscuroth hits a creature with a weapon attack, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and the obscuroth can sense the direction an distance to the target as long as they are on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The obscuroth makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the obscuroth regains hit points equal to the damage taken.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unseen Assault (Recharge 6)
entries: The obscuroth makes four attacks with its claws against one target. Either before or after these attacks, it can turn {@condition invisible} as a bonus action until the start of its next turn.

reaction.name: Psionic Rebuke
entries: When the obscuroth takes damage from a creature the obscuroth can see within 60 feet of it, it can force that creature to make a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The vozhark's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 22, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
will: {@spell eldritch blast} (4 beams, +7 bonus to each damage roll)

trait.name: Flaying Pseudopod
entries: The vozhark makes a pseudopod attack (no action required) against any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the vozhark if the vozhark isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vozhark fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Psionic Shroud
entries: The vozhark is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as all divination spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vozhark makes three attacks: one with its claws and two with is pseudopods and, if it can, uses its Cosmic Revelation. It can use Grasping Tentacle in place of any pseudopod attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 22). The vozhark has ten pseudopods, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Grasping Tentacle
entries: The vozhark extends one tentacle to lash out at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 22 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the vozhark. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn' t pulled.

action.name: Cosmic Revelation (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vozhark projects visions of cosmic horror into the minds of creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. A creature must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the vozhark's next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature is under the effects of the confusion spell.

reaction.name: Hostile Telepathic Transfer
entries: When the vozhark takes damage, a creature of the vozhark's choice within 2 miles of it takes psychic damage equal to that amount instead; the vozhark takes none of the damage.

legendary.name: Psychic Shock
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by the vozhark takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vozhark casts one spell from its Innate Spellcasting trait.

legendary.name: Eldritch Star (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vozhark flies up to half its flying speed and then sheds green bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet until the start of its next turn. When the light appears, each creature in it must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any creature that ends its turn within the bright light must also make this saving throw and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Necromancer's Moon
entries: When the vozhark uses Eldritch Star, the damage is necrotic instead of radiant. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this damage. A humanoid killed in this way rises at the start of the vozhark's next turn as an undead. If the humanoid had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. If it had 6 or more Hit Dice, it becomes a wight.

entries.name: Extinguish Life (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vozhark targets one creature that it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the target is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Harbinger of Death (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vozhark uses Extinguish Life, if it can.

entries.name: Out-of-Phase Movement
entries: The vozhark can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain . Each creature it moves through takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The vozhark takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Lurker at the Threshold (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The vozhark moves itself and up to seven other creatures it can see through the flow of time, moving {@dice 1d10 x 100} years forward or backward (vozhark's choice). Only the vozhark is immediately aware of the time change. A wish spell can return the caster and up to seven other creatures designated by the caster to their normal time. Alternatively, the vozhark shifts itself and up to seven other creatures it can see to another plane of existence.

entries.name: Twist Time
entries: The vozhark changes its place in the initiative order, choosing its new initiative. The vozhark can't change its place in the initiative order more than once per round in this way.

entries.name: Change Gravity (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vozhark casts the reverse gravity spell. The spell has the normal effect, except that the vozhark can orient the area in any direction and creatures and objects fall toward the end of the area.

entries.name: Psionic Might
entries: The vozhark can maintain concentration on two different enchantment or illusion spells at the same time. In addition, it has advantage on saving throws to maintain concentration on spells.

entries.name: Rending the Veil (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The vozhark targets a creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must make a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 100 psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Call of Cthulhu (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vozhark targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vozhark until a remove curse spell is cast on it. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the vozhark's verbal or telepathic commands.

entries.name: Foul Regeneration
entries: The vozhark regains 30 hit points at the start of its turn. If the vozhark is targeted by dispel magic or is in the area of an antimagic field, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vozhark's next turn. The vozhark dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Birth of a Thousand Young (3/Day)
entries: In response to taking piercing or slashing damage, the vozhark gives birth through the wound to an aberration of challenge rating 10 or lower, or {@dice 1d4 + 1} aberrations of challenge rating 5 or lower. An aberration appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the vozhark and acts on its own initiative count.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the banisher dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 82 ({@damage 15d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
entries: The banisher has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If the banisher is subjected to a spell or magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The banisher makes two force strike attacks.

action.name: Force Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Force Unleash (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The banisher emits destructive energy in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line make a DC 19 Strength saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is pushed 30 feet away from the banisher and is knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Spell Return
entries: In response to a creature casting a spell targeting the banisher, the banisher redirects it against the caster, turning the caster into the target.

legendary.name: Force Strike
entries: The banisher uses Force Strike.

legendary.name: Poison Essence
entries: The banisher targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the next spell cast by the target deals to the target {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage per level of the spell.

legendary.name: Banish Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The banisher emits an aura of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on the banisher, until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Siphon Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The banisher targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The banisher rolls a {@dice d8}, and the target loses a spell slot of that level or lower. If the target has no spell slots left of that level or lower, nothing happens.

trait.name: Fanatical Devotion
entries: The flagellant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. While the flagellant can see a friendly, higher-ranking member of its religion, the flagellant ignores the effects of being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Flaying
entries: As a bonus action, the flagellant loses 6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2}) hit points, and gains advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls until the end of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flagellant makes two attacks: one with its flail and one with its torch.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Torch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire , the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Burn the Witch
entries: Immediately after an enemy the flagellant can see cast a spell within 90 feet of it, the flagellant can move up to its speed. It can then make one torch attack against the spellcaster.

trait.name: Interrogator
entries: The witchfinder knows when it hears a creature speak a lie in a language it knows.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witchfinder makes three attacks: two with its branding flail and one with its pincer staff.

action.name: Branding Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Pincer Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the witchfinder can't use its pincer staff on another target. A creature takes 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails.

action.name: Suppress Magic (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The witchfinder targets one magic item it can see within 120 feet of it. If the magic item isn't an artifact, its magical properties are suppressed for 10 minutes, or until the witchfinder is {@condition incapacitated} or dies.

legendary.name: Accuse
entries: The witchfinder targets one creature it can see 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the witchfinder, it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the witchfinder until the end of the target's next turn.

legendary.name: Pincer
entries: One creature that the witchfinder is grappling with its pincer staff takes 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Brand the Heretic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The witchfinder makes a branding flail attack against a creature. If the attack hits, the target is branded as a heretic. When the branded target tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, or the casting fails and the spell is wasted. The brand remains until removed by the lesser restoration spell or other magic

legendary.name: Reveal Witchcraft (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The witchfinder brandishes its religious symbol and reveals all illusions and shapechangers within 30 feet of itself. An illusion spell instantly ends, while a permanent illusion appears translucent. A shapechanger or a transformed creature must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it reverts to its original form and can't assume a different form until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: In addition to its weapons, a hunter carries two deep lead bomb, a set of deep lead shackles, and a witch-catcher.

trait.name: Protection of Hatred
entries: The hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Witch-Slayer
entries: When the hunter hits a spellcaster with a weapon attack, the creature takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage of the weapon's type.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hunter makes three melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Deep Lead Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Silvered Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Witch-Counter
entries: In response to a creature within 5 feet of the hunter casting a spell, it can make a melee weapon attack with advantage against that creature. If the attack hits, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the damage taken, or its spell fails and is wasted. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of the hunter's next turn.

feat.name: Great Weapon Master 2
entries: You've learned to put the weight of a weapon to your advantage, letting its momentum empower your strikes. You gain the following benefits:

items: On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
Before you make a melee attack with a heavy weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

legendaryGroup.name: Alquam
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Alquam takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Alquam can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Alquam snuffs all light sources within the lair. Spells that create light are dispelled, mundane light sources are extinguished, and magical light sources are suppressed. Even light created by artifacts is reduced to dim light with half its normal radius of illumination. This lasts until initiative count 20 on the following round.

Haunting, maddening music emanates from a point Alquam can see. Creatures within 50 feet of the origin that can hear the music must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Those that fail are charmed, incapacitated, and have their speed reduced to 0 until they take damage or until initiative count 20 on the following round.

Black tendrils writhe around up to three creatures Alquam can see within 100 feet. The creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be restrained until initiative count 20 on the following round.

regionalEffects: The region containing Alquam's lair is warped by the demon lord's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Within 1 mile of the lair all light sources except artifacts shed light to only half the usual radius.
Owls and other nocturnal beasts become enraged and hostile within 5 miles of the lair, attacking intruders individually and in swarms.
Within 1 mile of the lair, Alquam can cast his senses into any area of dim light or darkness as if using {@spell clairvoyance}.

regionalEffects: If Alquam dies, conditions in the area surrounding the lair return to normal over the course of 1d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Bear King
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Bear King takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the Bear King can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The Bear King magically conjures up a swarm of eight giant bees (use {@creature giant wasp} statistics) to defend his lair. The bees act immediately, and on initiative count 20 in subsequent rounds. The bees remain until they're killed or until the Bear King dismisses them as an action. The Bear King can use this action again, but no more than eight giant bees can be present at a time.

The Bear King targets a creature within the lair that he can see. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be magically transformed into a brown bear as if by a {@spell polymorph} spell. At the beginning of its turn, a transformed creature repeats the saving throw. If it fails, the creature must use its action to attack one of the Bear King's foes. If it succeeds, the effect ends and the creature returns to its normal form. The effect lasts until the creature succeeds on the saving throw or until the Bear King uses this lair action again.

The Bear King causes the ground in a 20-foot radius to tremble and shake. Any creatures in the affected area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or suffer 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. The ground continues to tremble until initiative count 20 on the following round, during which time the area is difficult terrain.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding Gloaming Crag is warped by the Bear King's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Within 10 miles of the Bear King's lair, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid contracting lycanthropy from a werebear.
Bees within 10 miles of the Bear King's lair are easily agitated and quick to attack. Insect swarms (bees or hornets) are common in the area, but they tend to ignore locals.
Emotions within 5 miles of the Bear King's lair run high. Arguments quickly descend into physical scuffles and enjoyable get-togethers are likely to become raucous carousing or even brawls.

regionalEffects: If the Bear King dies, conditions in the area surrounding the lair return to normal over the course of 1d6 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Emperor Of The Ghouls
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Emperor takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects.The Emperor can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Until initiative count 20 on the following round, all creatures other than undead and constructs who take necrotic damage take an additional 7 ({@dice 2d6}) necrotic damage.

The emperor targets a creature within 30 feet that he can see. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@dice 4d8}) necrotic damage. The emperor regains hit points equal to the damage.

A wall of ice springs up from a surface within 100 feet of the emperor. The wall is 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. A creature in the wall's space when it appears must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@dice 3d6}) cold damage; then the creature is pushed to either side of the wall (the creature's choice). Each 5-foot section of the wall has AC 10, 15 hit points, resistance to piercing and slashing damage, immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage, and vulnerability to fire damage. The wall lasts until the emperor uses this action again, or dies.

regionalEffects: The region around the emperor's lair is warped by its magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Creatures within 1 mile of the lair who are infected with darakhul fever have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws against spells and effects generated by ghouls or darakhul.

Dead bodies within 1 mile of the lair have an 80 percent chance to reanimate as skeletons or zombies 24 hours after their death. These undead never attack ghouls or dharakul, but instinctively obey their commands.

Phantom lights appear within 10 miles of the lair, more frequently the closer they are to the lair. The lights shed dim light out to 10 feet. Undead within such a light gain {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points at the start of their turn; the light can't raise an undead's hit points above 150 percent of its normal hit point maximum.

regionalEffects: If the emperor dies, conditions in the area surrounding the lair return to normal over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Flame Dragon
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: A cloud of smoke swirls in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The cloud spreads around corners and the area is lightly obscured. Each creature in the cloud must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The ground erupts with volcanic force at a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. Any creature within 20 feet of the point must make a successful DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone and trapped in the ground. A creature trapped in this way is restrained and can't stand up. A creature can end the restraint if it or another creature takes an action to make a successful DC 15 Strength check.

A wall of fire rises up from the ground within 120 feet of the dragon. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick, can take any shape the dragon wants, and blocks line of sight. When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. A creature that fails the saving throw takes 21 ({@dice 6d6}) fire damage. Each creature that enters the wall for the first time each turn or ends its turn there takes 21 ({@dice 6d6}) fire damage. The wall is extinguished when the dragon uses this lair action again or when the dragon dies.

regionalEffects: The region containing a legendary flame dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Arguments and misunderstandings erupt easily within 6 miles of the lair. Friendships are easily broken and criminal acts are common.
Temperatures rise within 6 miles of the lair. Crops wither, producing famines.

Sulfur geysers form in and around the dragon's lair. Some of them erupt only once an hour, so they're spotted only with a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Perception) check. A creature on top of an erupting geyser takes 21 ({@dice 6d6}) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 15 Dexterity saving throw.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, the arguments and misunderstandings disappear immediately and the temperatures go back to normal within {@dice 1d10} days. Any geysers remain where they are.

legendaryGroup.name: Hraesvelgr
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Hraesvelgr takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Hraesvelgr can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Hraesvelgr unleashes a blast of wind in a 60-foot cone. All creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

One creature within 60 feet that Hraesvelgr can see must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be swept up in a pillar of wind. The creature is restrained and suspended 15 feet off the ground. If the creature has something to pull on, it can pull itself out of the wind by using an action and making a successful DC 15 Strength check; another creature who can reach the suspended creature can pull it free in the same way. Alternatively, a flying creature can repeat the saving throw as an action. On a success, it moves 5 feet out of the pillar of wind. This effect lasts until Hraesvelgr takes this action again or dies.

Hraesvelgr lets out a thunderous bellow in giant form or an ear-splitting shriek in roc form. All creatures within 30 feet must make a successful DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

regionalEffects: The region containing Hraesvelgr's lair is warped by the corpse swallower's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Strong windstorms are common within 6 miles of the lair.
Giant avian beasts are drawn to the lair and fiercely defend it against intruders.
The wind within 10 miles of the lair bears a pungent carrion stench.

regionalEffects: If Hraesvelgr dies, conditions in the area surrounding the lair return to normal over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Koschei
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Koschei takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects. Koschei can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Koschei creates a whirlwind centered on a point he can see within 100 feet. The whirlwind is 10 feet wide and up to 50 feet tall. A creature in the area of the whirlwind when it's created, or who enters the area for the first time on a turn, must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is restrained and takes 18 ({@dice 4d8}) bludgeoning damage from the buffeting wind. A restrained creature can escape from the whirlwind by using its action to repeat the saving throw; on a success, it moves 5 feet outside the area of the whirlwind. The whirlwind lasts until Koschei uses this action again or dies.

Tortured spirits appear and attack up to three creatures Koschei can see within the lair. One attack is made against each targeted creature; each attack has +8 to hit and does 10 ({@dice 3d6}) necrotic damage.

Koschei disrupts the flow of magic in his lair. Until initiative count 20 on the following round, any creature other than a fiend who targets Koschei with a spell must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature still casts the spell, but it must target a creature other than Koschei.

regionalEffects: The region containing Koschei's lair is warped by Koschei's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Rabbits, ducks, and other game animals become hostile toward intruders within 5 miles of the lair. They behave aggressively, but only attack if cornered. Foraging for food by hunting is difficult and only yields half the normal amount of food.
Wind and snowstorms are common within 5 miles of the lair.
Koschei is aware of any spell cast within 5 miles of his lair. He knows the source of the magic (innate, the caster's class, or a magic item) and knows the direction to the caster.

regionalEffects: If Koschei dies, conditions in the area surrounding his lair return to normal over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Lord of the Hunt
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Lord of the Hunt takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the Lord of the Hunt can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The Lord of the Hunt chooses a point he can see within the lair. Plants erupt from the ground in a 20-foot radius surrounding that point, creating difficult terrain. Any creatures in the area at the start of their turn, or who enter the area for the first time on a turn, must make a successful DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained by the vines and take 13 (3d8) poison damage. A creature can be freed if it or an adjacent ally uses an action to make a successful DC 15 Strength check. This effect lasts until the Lord of the Hunt uses this lair action again, or dies.

The Lord of the Hunt lets out a war cry. A creature the Lord can see within 120 feet must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The Lord of the Hunt magically marks a target he can see within 120 feet. The Lord has advantage on attack rolls against the marked target. The mark lasts until initiative count 20 on the following turn.

regionalEffects: The region containing Lord of the Hunt's encampment is warped by his magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Game animals become plentiful within 3 miles of the lair. Wisdom (Survival) checks to hunt for food are made with advantage, but patrols from the Wild Hunt don't take kindly to poachers.
